definition: to be dispersed/to break down/to fester/to ulcerate
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: The arrival of the crack troops in the battle field augured ill for the Germans.
sentences.chinese: 精锐部队到达战场，预兆着德军的溃败。

sentences.english: The ref FSV mainz give all brings the serious influence.
sentences.chinese: 远征军的大溃败给一切人都带来严重影响。

sentences.english: After the Iraq debacle, all claims must be examined closely.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克溃败之后，所有的索赔都要仔细审查。

sentences.english: After his latest debacle, we will let him stew in his own juice and suffer the consequences.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一次溃败后，我们会让他自作自受。

sentences.english: The officers were still reluctant to unleash their troops in pursuit of a defeated enemy.
sentences.chinese: 军官们仍不愿发兵乘胜追击溃败的敌人。

sentences.english: In a couple of decades there could be a French-style implosion.
sentences.chinese: 在二十年中，可能会发生法式风格的向内腐烂溃败。

sentences.english: The rebellion failed, however, when Western powers intervened and stopped the revolt.
sentences.chinese: 八国联军溃败，西方势力调停并结束了这场叛乱。

sentences.english: The defeated troops regrouped at the foot of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 溃败的部队在山脚下重新聚集在一起。

sentences.english: The siege was lifted and general Linghu's army fled the field.
sentences.chinese: 围城之急解除了，令狐潮的军队溃败逃离。

sentences.english: An entire division was routed during the first hours of the war.
sentences.chinese: 在战争的头几个小时中，整师就彻底溃败了。

sentences.english: It's not clear at what point this will turn into a cull or a rout.
sentences.chinese: 什么时候碳市场会被淘汰或溃败还不清楚。

sentences.english: Chinese military history is filled with turn and flee actions.
sentences.chinese: 中国的军事史充满了溃败。

definition: troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to collapse on the first encounter/to give way at once
